item.title: MayimFlow wants to stop data center leaks before they happen
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Leaks cause damage, down time, and cost money. MayimFlow's founder John Khazraee wants to change that.

item.title: India startup funding hits $11B in 2025 as investors grow more selective
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Startup funding rounds in India fell sharply in 2025 as investors concentrated capital into fewer companies.

item.title: How reality crushed Ÿnsect, the French startup that had raised over $600M for insect farming
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: French insect farming company Ÿnsect was recently placed into judicial liquidation for insolvency, despite raising over $600 million.

item.title: Equity’s 2026 Predictions: AI Agents, Blockbuster IPOs, and the Future of VC
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Rebecca Bellan, Anthony Ha, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: TechCrunch’s Equity crew is bringing 2025 to a close and getting ahead on the year to come with our annual predictions episode! Hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan were joined by Build Mode host Isabelle Johannessen to dissect the year’s biggest tech developments, from mega AI funding rounds that defied expectations to the rise of “physical AI,” and make […]

item.title: Naware’s chemical-free weed killer tech could change how we treat lawns
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: A classic hardware startup, Naware set out with a problem -- kill weeds without chemicals -- and relentlessly tinkered until they found a solution.

item.title: How a Spanish virus brought Google to Málaga
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Spanish entrepreneur Bernardo Quintero, whose company is at the root of Google's Málaga cybersecurity hub, identified the author of the computer virus that influenced his career.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.

item.title: Why the operating room is ripe for AI, according to Akara
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between, from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to […]

item.title: Marissa Mayer’s new startup Dazzle raises $8M led by Forerunner’s Kirsten Green
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Mayer launched Dazzle after shuttering her photo and contact management startup Sunshine. Green’s investment suggests Dazzle is poised for the coming wave of new AI-infused consumer businesses.

item.title: The tooth fairy just got reimagined for the tech-savvy generation
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tooth Fairy Tracker features Kiki the Tooth Fairy as its central character. When a child loses a tooth, parents can visit the website and enter their email to receive notifications as Kiki begins her mission.
